intro: Restio anceps, commonly known as the narrowleaf restio, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Restionaceae family and is characterized by its slender, grass-like appearance. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny white or pale yellow flowers. Restio anceps typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy or rocky soils. It plays a role in stabilizing coastal dunes and provides habitat for various small organisms.
